### Summary

I propose to add a `--reuse-external` configuration option as a weaker but more deterministic alternative to the new `--reuse` interface coming to Spack.

### Rationale

The idea is to avoid reinstalling available system packages, but don't try to actively reuse previously Spack-installed packages. I believe this would retain a majority of the predictability that we currently have, while avoiding the overhead of reinstalling system packages. This may even be a less drastic candidate for the new default than `--reuse`. I understand the new `--reuse` interface is currently experimental and an interface based on config files is in the works. A possible interface would be an option like this in an environment's `spack.yaml` file:

```yaml
concretization: together
# ...
reuse: external  # or: none, all
```
